intro: Zauschneria latifolia var. typica, commonly known as the broadleaf marsh marigold, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in wet meadows, marshes, and streambanks, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, often with a waxy coating, and it can reach heights of up to 3 feet. Zauschneria latifolia var. typica plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
